snippet: Three months after the attack that killed Ambassador J. Christopher Stevens, the Libyan authorities are loath to move against Islamist extremist suspects who belong to powerful militias.
abstract: Investigation into attacks on American Mission in Benghazi, Libya, is being hampered by reluctance of Libyan authorities to move against Islamist extremist suspects belonging to powerful militias.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim and David D. Kirkpatrick contributed reporting from Benghazi, Libya.

lead_paragraph: Three months after the attack that killed Ambassador J. Christopher Stevens, the Libyan authorities are loath to move against Islamist extremist suspects who belong to powerful militias.

headline.seo: Libyan Reluctance Hobbles Benghazi Assault Investigation
headline.main: Libyan Reluctance Hampers U.S. Investigation Into Deadly Benghazi Assault
headline.print_headline: Libyan Reluctance Hampers U.S. Investigation Into Deadly Benghazi Assault
